required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Image Evaluation of Philips Philips MammoDiagnost DR Full Field Digital Mammography System (FFDM)
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Image Evaluation Study for Philips MammoDiagnost DR Full Field Digital Mammography System (FFDM)

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this investigation, using hardcopy film, is to compare the accuracy of the Philips MammoDiagnost DR (FFDM device) and screen-film (SF) mammography in detection of breast cancer among women undergoing screening or diagnostic mammography.
Per the new FDA Guidance document for FFDM, accuracy in comparison to Screen-film is no longer required.

primary_outcome.measure: FFDM (Full Field Digital Mammography) Mammogram Scores
primary_outcome.description: 6 mammography image sets (4 images per set) from women participating in the study were read and rated (pass/fail) by 2 MQSA (Mammorgraphy Quality Standards Act) certified mammography readers. A typical MQSA evaluation was performed on each image set and an image set was scored Pass or Fail. A total of 12 scores (6 image sets, 2 readers) were obtained.

arm_group.description: Mammograms from the Philips Digital System

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patient underwent or is scheduled to undergo a screening or diagnostic mammogram examination (right and left craniocaudal and mediolateral oblique with or without special views) at one of the acquisition centers during the course of this research study.
2. At least 40 years of age
3. Provides written informed consent indicating willingness to participate in this research study prior to performance of the Philips FFDM mammogram
4. Meets none of the exclusion criteria
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Presence of a breast implant,
2. Patients undergoing a unilateral mammogram or an incomplete SF mammogram
3. had previously undergone an excisional breast biopsy
4. Pregnant women or patients who believe they may be pregnant
(f) Inmates (in accordance with 45 CFR 46.306)
(g) Patients who cannot, for any reason, undergo follow-up mammography examinations (where clinically indicated) at the participating institution

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment was initiated at out primary Diagnostic site in April 2010 and concluded in February 2011. A total of 35 diagnostic cases were obtained. Recruitment was initiated at out primary Screening site in May 2010 and concluded in November 2011. A total of 67 screening cases were obtained.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The trial was to evaluate performance of a FFDM system. During image acquisition FDA modified the trial criteria from an efficacy trial to a SE trial. Images from our diag site prior to Nov could not be used in this study as mag views were now required. Mag views were acquired in Jan-Feb 2011. Selected images were used from our screen site.

group.title: FFDM (Full Field Digital Mammography)
group.description: Mammograms from the Philips Digital System

participants_list.participants: FDA Guidance: Class II Special Controls Guidance Document: Full-Field Digital Mammography System
Not all patient images were used for the reader evaluation based on new FDA Guidelines

group.title: FFDM (Full Field Digital Mammography)
group.description: Mammograms from the Philips Digital System

outcome.title: FFDM (Full Field Digital Mammography) Mammogram Scores
outcome.description: 6 mammography image sets (4 images per set) from women participating in the study were read and rated (pass/fail) by 2 MQSA (Mammorgraphy Quality Standards Act) certified mammography readers. A typical MQSA evaluation was performed on each image set and an image set was scored Pass or Fail. A total of 12 scores (6 image sets, 2 readers) were obtained.
outcome.population: This was not a statistical sample per FDA FFDM Guideline. FDA Guideline specified that a minimum of 6 film sets from the participants be analyzed. The number of participants required by FDA changed mid-study.

group.title: FFDM Mammograms Score = Pass
group.description: Mammogram sets from the Philips Digital System with Pass score for Image Quality

group.title: FFDM Mammograms Score = Fail
group.description: Mammogram sets from the Philips Digital System with Fail score for Image Quality

measure.description: 6 mammography image sets (4 images per set) from women participating in the study were read and rated (pass/fail) by 2 MQSA (Mammorgraphy Quality Standards Act) certified mammography readers. A typical MQSA evaluation was performed on each image set and an image set was scored Pass or Fail. A total of 12 scores (6 image sets, 2 readers) were obtained.
measure.population: This was not a statistical sample per FDA FFDM Guideline. FDA Guideline specified that a minimum of 6 film sets from the participants be analyzed. The number of participants required by FDA changed mid-study.

group.title: FFDM (Full Field Digital Mammography)
group.description: Mammograms from the Philips Digital System

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Change in requirements from FDA modified the reading study per the Nov 5, 2010 FDA Guideline for FFDM.
